comments:
To reproduce on M5:
1) Delete the org.eclipse.jdt.debug.ui plugin from the plugins folder.
2) Start Eclipse.
3) Switch to the Java Perspective. The workbench will popup a dialog with the 
following error:

org.eclipse.swt.SWTException: Failed to execute runnable 
(java.lang.NullPointerException)
	at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:1887)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Synchronizer.runAsyncMessages
(Synchronizer.java:96)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.runAsyncMessages(Display.java:1389)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.readAndDispatch(Display.java:1211)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.runEventLoop(Workbench.java:836)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.run(Workbench.java:819)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.run
(InternalBootLoader.java:777)
	at org.eclipse.core.boot.BootLoader.run(BootLoader.java:319)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Native Method)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:190)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:549)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:390)
*** Stack trace of contained exception ***
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at 
org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.DebugActionGroupsManager.processContributionItems
(DebugActionGroupsManager.java:192)
	at 
org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.DebugActionGroupsManager.updateDebugActionGroups
(DebugActionGroupsManager.java:176)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.DebugActionGroupsManager$1.run
(DebugActionGroupsManager.java:233)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.RunnableLock.run(RunnableLock.java:29)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Synchronizer.runAsyncMessages
(Synchronizer.java:93)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.runAsyncMessages(Display.java:1389)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.readAndDispatch(Display.java:1211)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.runEventLoop(Workbench.java:836)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.run(Workbench.java:819)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.run
(InternalBootLoader.java:777)
	at org.eclipse.core.boot.BootLoader.run(BootLoader.java:319)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Native Method)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:190)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:549)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:390)

If you debug the exception, it is thrown in 
DebugActionGroupsManager.processContributionItems() because the 
fDebugActionGroupActionIds variable is not initialized.

Following it back, the problem happens because fDebugActionGroupActionIds is 
never initialized in the initialize() method if there are no plugins that 
extend the debugActionGroups extension point.

This problem can be solved by removing the if statement from the code below, or 
checking for fDebugActionGroupActionIds==null in processContributionItems(). 
This problem is fairly obscure, but I've set it to P2 because it's actually 
causing our self hosting environment (the Run-time Workbench launcher) to crash 
whenever it hits the problem.

private void initialize() throws CoreException {
		fDebugActionGroups = new HashMap(10);
		IPluginDescriptor descriptor = DebugUIPlugin.getDefault
().getDescriptor();
		IExtensionPoint extensionPoint =
			descriptor.getExtensionPoint
(IDebugUIConstants.EXTENSION_POINT_DEBUG_ACTION_GROUPS);
		IConfigurationElement[] infos = 
extensionPoint.getConfigurationElements();
		if (infos.length > 0) { // <--
			fDebugActionGroupActionIds = new HashMap();
		}

Fixed in the latest integration builds.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 13554 ***
